revised_title: James McFadyen McNeill: A Pioneering Naval Architect and Ship Designer
tldr: James McFadyen McNeill was a renowned naval architect and ship designer who dedicated his life to the design and construction of ships. He played a significant role in the development of passenger ships during the early 20th century, focusing on improving their size, speed, and comfort. McNeill's work in the experimental tank at John Brown & Co. contributed to the advancement of ship design, and his achievements in the field are still considered a peak of accomplishment in the industry.
